place.name: STAVERTON
place.gazetteerText: STAVERTON, a parish, with a village, in Cheltenham district, Gloucester; 4 miles W of Cheltenham r. station. Post town, Cheltenham. Acres, 720. Real property, £1,682. Pop. 315. Houses, 68. S. Court is the seat of Capt. J. L. St. Clair; and S. House, of H. Sheldon, Esq. The living is a vicarage, united with Boddington, in the diocese of Gloucester and Bristol. Value, £436.* Patron, Mrs. Blagdon. The church is early English. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
